name: broot
description: New way to see and navigate directory trees

repo.name: broot
repo.description: A new way to see and navigate directory trees : https://dystroy.org/broot

readme.summary: Excellent visual examples and clear use cases, but missing installation instructions, configuration details, and troubleshooting guidance in this README.
readme.top_issue: No installation instructions in the README itself - only links to external documentation, making it impossible to install without navigating away

injection_risks.description: Potential command injection risk with launchable.execute(None), as it may execute user-provided input without proper validation.

critical_findings: Potential command injection risk with launchable.execute(None).
security.summary: The broot package has some security concerns, including potential command injection risks and a lack of explicit input validation, but no hardcoded secrets or severe error exposure issues were found.

common_complaints: Feature requests around verb/command execution workflows
Image preview protocol limitations (no kitty support in multiplexers)
praise_themes: Active feature development and enhancement focus
sentiment.summary: The broot project shows strong community health with an active maintainer addressing feature requests, mostly enhancement suggestions rather than bug complaints, and recent issue activity indicating ongoing engagement.

communication.summary: The maintainer's responses are generally helpful, clear, and patient, making them a valuable resource for users and contributors of the broot package.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite recent activity timestamp
241 open issues with no resolution activity
Zero closed issues in past 6 months indicates no maintenance
No merged PRs in past 6 months shows no active development
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release suggests version management has stopped
maintenance.summary: The broot project appears abandoned with no maintenance activity over the past 6 months despite a large backlog of unresolved issues.

changelog.summary: The changelog is well-organized and comprehensive, but lacks clear markings for breaking changes and migration guides.

governance.summary: The governance documentation for the homebrew package 'broot' lacks a clear succession plan, decision-making process, and contributor ladder, indicating a high bus factor risk.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is comprehensive and provides many examples, but installation instructions are not directly available in the README and troubleshooting information is lacking.
concerns: Docs: Lack of direct installation instructions and troubleshooting information in the README
Governance: High bus factor risk identified
Security: Potential command injection risk with launchable.execute(None).
High bus factor risk (90% from top contributor)
